title: HSTS cookies
content:
OK, I have Firefox (Windows 10 AMD64, desktop) configured to delete history when I close it.

So, I see that regular webiste cookies are deleted.

But are the HSTS website "super cookies" deleted?

https://ipleak.com/articles/what-is-hsts-super-cookies What are HSTS Super cookies and why are they dangerous?


thanx.
creator: mike.543

title: I Suspect a PC repair co., That has had take remote access in the past by several different app's is some how accessing my PC without consent is this possible??
content:
I'm very frustrated being a novice PC user! I Suspect a PC repair Co., that has had remote access to my PC in the past of some how accessing my Private network of 7 device's and making sure that some where on my network any of several app's they have used before to take remote access of my PC! I first noticed a problem after this co. initially set up my network. I would be on my PC and see the Any desk app soft ware. So I did uninstall the any desk app where ever I saw it on my network. This co. would call me and tell me to be sure and take advantage of their monthly tune up. Keep in mind I was scared into purchasing 3 year support package. I turned on my PC today,after using Google as my default Browser for a long time. I decided to try Firefox I was very disappointed to see that Firefox had been set up and the third bookmark was something called Take Remote. This Co. Is still in Business and my account is active. In my opinion I believe that all HACKER'S should have their hand's CUT OFF. Again I am a novice user, But for some one who use's their knowledge and their Company to prey on people like me, There Should be consequence's!!! I Would Greatly Appreciate any help or Advice you could help me with! 

                                                                                Thank, You                                                                                                                                                                         Michael Ruschman
creator: 6hjqvqh8pm

title: Open a new tab, cannot copy text
content:
When I click on a link and say to open the link in a new tab, there's an issue.

The "Copy" in the context menu for that new tab is grayed out, i.e., cannot be selected.

So I have to go back to the origin page, and then re-select the new, just opened tab.

After I do that, the "Copy" is no longer grayed out.

Is this a bug?

If so, how do I report it?

Many thanks.
creator: mike.543

title: Best Firefox Add-ons for Enhancing User Experience on Home Improvement Websites?
content:
Hi Mozilla community,

I'm the owner of a home improvement website,https://thehomeandtown.com/ The Home and Town, and I'm looking for ways to enhance the user experience for my visitors who primarily use Firefox. Are there any specific Firefox add-ons or extensions that you would recommend to improve website navigation, content readability, or overall user engagement? Additionally, are there any best practices for optimizing my website specifically for Firefox users?

Your insights would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you!"

By framing your question this way, you not only make it relevant to the Mozilla Support community but also subtly introduce your website, increasing the chances of getting valuable feedback and a backlink.
creator: ahmadshehzad4452

title: can't delete autofill unwanted suggestion from form history after firefox update
content: since the last update (firefox 127.0 or 127.0.1), i can't delete unwanted suggestion from autofil history anymore (the right search engine tool bar words with the clock icon or any website search bar) each time i want to delete the unwanted word, it reappear immediately after in the suggestion list.
